private_information: I can pick up, put down, unstack and stack blocks following standard BlocksWorld single-arm rules.
I am assigned to perform the first 25 actions in the provided action sequence.
I can observe and report the state changes produced by my actions.
robot1.goal: Execute and report the effect of my assigned actions on the block configuration.

private_information: I can pick up, put down, unstack and stack blocks following standard BlocksWorld single-arm rules.
I am assigned to perform the last 25 actions in the provided action sequence.
I can observe and report the state changes produced by my actions.
robot2.goal: Execute and report the effect of my assigned actions on the block configuration.

private_information: I coordinate reports from the two robots and must produce a single consistent final description.
I must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that captures the final arrangement.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents reports and emit a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver and describing the final block arrangement.

public_information: BlocksWorld rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial arrangement: A is on D, B is on K, C is on the table, D is on the table, E is on L, F is on H, G is on I, H is on J, I is on C, J is on the table, K is on the table, L is on A.

Action sequence to execute in order: 1 unstack(G,I) 2 stack(G,E) 3 unstack(I,C) 4 stack(I,B) 5 unstack(I,B) 6 stack(I,F) 7 unstack(B,K) 8 putdown(B) 9 pickup(C) 10 putdown(C) 11 unstack(I,F) 12 stack(I,F) 13 pickup(C) 14 putdown(C) 15 unstack(G,E) 16 stack(G,I) 17 pickup(C) 18 stack(C,E) 19 unstack(G,I) 20 stack(G,K) 21 unstack(C,E) 22 stack(C,I) 23 unstack(G,K) 24 putdown(G) 25 pickup(K) 26 stack(K,G) 27 unstack(C,I) 28 stack(C,B) 29 unstack(I,F) 30 putdown(I) 31 unstack(C,B) 32 stack(C,K) 33 pickup(B) 34 stack(B,C) 35 unstack(F,H) 36 putdown(F) 37 pickup(F) 38 stack(F,I) 39 unstack(F,I) 40 putdown(F) 41 pickup(F) 42 stack(F,I) 43 unstack(F,I) 44 stack(F,I) 45 unstack(F,I) 46 stack(F,B) 47 unstack(F,B) 48 stack(F,H) 49 unstack(F,H) 50 putdown(F).
Task: using the initial configuration and the actions, derive the final arrangement of the blocks and produce a PDDL domain and problem encoding the final state for FastDownwards.

report.system_prompt: You are robot1 in a BlocksWorld environment. You are assigned the first 25 actions of the provided sequence. Describe step by step how each of your assigned actions changes local stacks. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a clear final local state summary listing for each block you touch whether it is on the table or on top of another block and which stacks changed as a result of your actions.
report.prompt: Your name is robot1. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->robot1->private_information}. Your assigned actions are actions 1 through 25 from the sequence in public information. Execute them mentally and provide a clear step by step textual report of the changes and a final local state summary. Do not output PDDL.

report.system_prompt: You are robot2 in a BlocksWorld environment. You are assigned the last 25 actions of the provided sequence. Describe step by step how each of your assigned actions changes local stacks. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a clear final local state summary listing for each block you touch whether it is on the table or on top of another block and which stacks changed as a result of your actions.
report.prompt: Your name is robot2. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->robot2->private_information}. Your assigned actions are actions 26 through 50 from the sequence in public information. Execute them mentally and provide a clear step by step textual report of the changes and a final local state summary. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator for a BlocksWorld instance and an expert in PDDL suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the two agents reports to form a single consistent final state. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the BlocksWorld domain and the final arrangement of all blocks as the goal state. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards and should keep the two agents actions conceptually distinct when relevant. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Here are the public facts: {environment->public_information}. Here is robot1's report: {robot1_report}. Here is robot2's report: {robot2_report}. Integrate them to compute the final arrangement of every block. Then emit a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting FastDownwards that encodes the BlocksWorld actions and sets the goal to the final arrangement. Enclose domain in <domain></domain> and problem in <problem></problem>. Keep agent actions distinct where appropriate.
